title: Amumu Jungle Build Help?
body: I would use mobafire, but its let me down pretty badly in that past. I usually get {{item:3706}} cinderhulk and build tank straight tank and try to get some of the tank items that have some kind of mana from there. Am i building him right?

replies.body:
I like to go with {{item:3713}} as opposed to {{item:3706}} .  Ranger's allows me to power farm and still be super healthy when gank opportunities arise.  I almost always go with the {{item:3725}} , although I do believe that {{item:3724}} is a valid enchantment as well if you know how to play Amumu as a mage.

After that my build depends on what kind of a team I'm against and how the game is going.

If the team is full AD I build: {{item:3117}} /{{item:3047}}  - {{item:3143}} -{{item:3110}} {{item:3075}} where the last item is dependent on whether I need more tankiness, more cdr, or some raw damage.  Typically it will be down to the following items: {{item:3083}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3800}}.

If the team I'm against is more hybrid damage that my build looks more like the following: {{item:3117}} /{{item:3111}}  - {{item:3001}} -{{item:3110}} -{{item:3190}} - with the final item once again being dependent on what the team actually looks like.

Try Probuilds.com, I typically have found good advice there. Pros will build different things to fit their situations, though, but it's great for getting a general idea of what kinds of things you want to build.

I would take Ranger's; his Q has much longer range than chilling smite and is more powerful CC anyways, plus Amumu tends to have mana issues, and Rangers really helps him sustain in jungle. I would build cinderhulk pretty much always; sunfire cape was an amazing item on Amumu, and now you get it for free with your jungle item. The only time I'd build Magus is if I'm just having fun and going full AP, though if you're really good with Amumu and know how to survive fights and stuff, it's another possibility.

{{item:3724}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3255}} magemumu too strong O:
(just don't miss Q and make sure your mid doesn't mind you monopolizing blue buff)

Build gives you max cdr, decent AP and plenty of m.pen along with defensive stats for when you dive in. my fave personal amumu build for sure ^_^

Generally what you want is situation.
You generally want {{item:3110}} if you're doing well and need mana, however if they have very powerful ADC's you might want {{item:3143}} 
{{item:3713}} is generally the way to go for smite.
When it comes to offensive items you want either a {{item:3001}} if your team has a lot of magic damage or {{item:3151}} if they're mostly AD.
A {{item:3116}} always helps because it gives you health and CC
{{item:3157}} and {{item:3102}} are good when against bursters, Banshees for Magic damage, Zhonyas for PD

I would avoid building mana unless it's {{item:3110}} but since you're building cinderhulk it's probably more benificial to get a {{item:3143}} instead to benefit from Cinderhulk's 25% bonus health amp.
Another way to build Amumu is a heavy AP build with Magus enchantment recommended for more experienced Amumu players that want to snowball an early lead.
Usefull items for both builds can be {{item:3001}} and {{item:3116}} as they increase your damage output, tankiness and utility. Amumu's damage is basically fully within the aura's range and Rylai's gives a permaslow with W active.

For guides in general I would recommend the featured guides on solomid.net, make sure the guide is not too outdated though.
